main event: Correspondence regarding an unidentified flying object sighting near Wales, North Dakota in September 1957.
interesting points: The object was analyzed and described as a metallic sphere, approximately 40-50 feet in diameter., The object was observed visually for periods up to 10 minutes by credible observers., The object was tracked on radar for a period of 35 minutes., Observers indicated that the object defies conventional aircraft characteristics., The correspondence includes a request for further analysis and evaluation from the Air Technical Intelligence Center.
witness description: The report mentions credible observers, but specific identities are not given.
